Fordham University | From the city to the world

Fordham University is a Catholic Jesuit university. Its spirit stems from the Jesuits’ nearly 500-year history. The university works with the spirit of wholehearted engagement—with profound ideas, communities all over the world, injustice, beauty, and the entirety of the human experience.

This is what distinguishes Fordham

New York City is a close-knit community that values and educates the whole person. Much of Fordham’s Jesuit history and mission can be boiled down to three concepts, which roughly translate as follows-

Strive for excellence in all you do.

Consider others.

Strive for justice.

It all adds up to an effective education.

Wisdom, experience, morality, critical thinking, and problem-solving creativity. This is what Fordham students bring with them into the world.

Fordham University | A brief overview

Fordham University is a private university that was established in 1841. It has a total undergraduate enrollment of 9,904 students (fall 2021), an urban setting, and a campus size of 125 acres. Fordham’s academic calendar is semester-based. Fordham University is ranked #72 in National Universities in the Best Colleges 2022-2023 edition. The total expenditure of tuition and fees is $58,082. According to the school’s website, ‘New York is (your) campus’ at Fordham University. Students live and learn in New York City on campuses located throughout the city. The New York Botanical Gardens, Bronx Zoo, and Little Italy are all within walking distance of the school’s original Bronx campus, Rose Hill. Fordham now has two additional campuses- Lincoln Center, near Central Park, and Westchester, in West Harrison, New York. Freshmen are not required to live on campus, but any student who gets housing facility upon admission is guaranteed a room for four years.

Students can use the school’s Ram Van, a burgundy shuttle that runs every half hour, to travel between campuses. The school calculated that the van makes enough trips to cover a distance equivalent to traveling around the world 18.5 times per year. The Fordham Rams compete in the Atlantic 10 Conference of the NCAA Division I.

Fordham University, a Jesuit university lacks a Greek system.

Among Fordham’s graduate schools is the highly regarded Fordham School of Law, which houses the country’s first Fashion Law Institute. The Louis Calder Center, a biological field station where environmental studies courses and research are conducted, is available to both graduates and undergraduates. To be closer to their research, a dozen graduate students can live in log cabins at the biological field station each year.

Campus

Fordham University has three campuses, namely the main campus in Rose Hill, the Lincoln campus, and the Westchester campus.

Students can take advantage of excellent facilities and services at each of the campuses. The university libraries have a rare and unique collection of digital and printed resources. Students at the Rose Hill and Lincoln campuses can easily take advantage of secure on-campus housing, dining halls, and a wellness center. The three-story building on the 32-acre Westchester Campus houses amenities such as meeting rooms, a media center, smart classrooms, and food services. Apart from that, it has an international campus in London called the London Centre, which hosts ‘study abroad’ programs. It also provides a wide range of courses in the liberal arts, business, and theatre. Located in Armonk, New York, the Louis Calder Centre is the university’s fourth campus. This campus contains 13 buildings for office space and labs, as well as a department that offers numerous research programs.

Fordham campuses

Lincoln center

The 8-acre Manhattan campus spans two city blocks and includes a landscaped plaza. It is home to over 7,000 undergraduate and graduate students, as well as Fordham College at Lincoln Center, the Gabelli School of Business, the School of Profession and Continuing Studies, and Graduate Schools of Arts and Sciences, Education, Social Service, and Law.

Rose Hill

It is an 85-acre campus in the Bronx that features Gothic architecture and tree-lined walkways. It is home to over 6,000 undergraduate and graduate students, as well as the Graduate School of Religion and Religious Studies.

Westchester

It is home to the Westchester branches of the Fordham School of Professional and Continuing Studies, as well as four institutes- the Beck Institute on Poverty and Religion, Children FIRST, National Center for Social Work Trauma Education, and the Ravazzin Center on Aging.

Courses

The university has ten academic schools that offer undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral degree programs. Students can major in the arts, science, religion, business, clinical psychology, education, social service, and law. Professional programs and continuing education are also available at the university. The total number of students enrolled at the university is 16,037, with 9,599 being undergraduates and 6,438 being postgraduates. It employs 735 full-time faculty, 437 tenured faculty, and 833 part-time instructional staff. Since 2003, the institution has given 185 Fulbright Scholarships and 1,597 awards to students. Every year, it contributes more than one million service hours to the community.

Key takeaways

Established in 1841, Fordham is a private university. Its total undergraduate enrollment for students in the fall of 2021 was 9,904. It is an urban setting with a campus size of 125 acres.

Fordham has three campuses, namely the Rose Hill, the Lincoln campus, and the Westchester campus. Students can benefit from excellent facilities and services at each of the campuses.

There are ten academic schools at Fordham that offer undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral degree programs. Students can choose from majors like arts, science, religion, business, and so on.

FAQs

Q1. Is Fordham an Ivy League school?

Ans- Fordham is not an Ivy League institution. It is notable for being New York City’s only Jesuit university, the city’s third-oldest university, and for its small class sizes.

Q2. What is the GPA to get admission at Fordham University?

Ans- All applicants must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and a grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0. (B). A minimum GPA of 3.5 is required if you have a post-graduate degree from an accredited college or university.
